abstract: A&P files for bankruptcy protection and plans to try and sell 120 stores; it is second time in five years company, which owns number of food retailers in New York, New Jersey and Pennsylvania, has filed for bankruptcy; collective bargaining agreements as well as employee pensions have so far proved obstacle in selling stores.
lead_paragraph: The former titan of the industry said that a restructuring in 2010 had failed to put it on secure enough financial footing to keep up with a shifting grocery landscape.

headline.main: A&P Files for Bankruptcy and Aims to Sell 120 Stores
headline.print_headline: A&P Files for Bankruptcy and Aims to Sell 120 Stores

snippet: The former titan of the industry said that a restructuring in 2010 had failed to put it on secure enough financial footing to keep up with a shifting grocery landscape.
